intro: Exallage pressa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems that bear fleshy, tuberous roots. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to prevent leaf scorching. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
